scene.name: intro
scene.line: The diner doesn't appear to have a name. A vinyl banner slung above the door simply reads: "24 Hours." It only has one window, behind which the blinds are tightly closed.

scene.name: try-door
scene.line: The door swings open easily. A bell rings nearby. The interior of the diner is pitch black.

option.insertedText: Conway enters the diner and closes the door behind him.
Conway stands in the doorway, waiting for his eyes to adjust.

scene.option: Wait a moment to adjust to the darkness.

option.insertedText: Conway closes the door and returns to his truck.

scene.name: wait-for-eyes
scene.line: A bit of errant light from the nearby highway creeps through the open door, and gradually Conway is able to make out a few figures inside:

scene.name: walk-in
scene.line: Someone shines a flashlight in Conway's eyes. The light is almost immediately blinding, but in the instant it switches on he can make out a few figures inside:

scene.name: describe-figures
scene.line: Two old men in trucker hats sit in a corner booth, with a checkers board set on the table between them.
A young woman standing behind the counter in an apron must be a waitress.
The cook stares blankly from the kitchen.

scene.name: door-closes
scene.line: The door slams shut, and the room is dark again.

option.insertedText: Conway walks in the direction of the counter.
Conway stumbles back out through the door, and returns to his truck.

scene.option: Try to open the door and leave.

scene.name: sit-at-counter
scene.line: He hits his knee on something hard and metallic, winces quietly, and then carefully finds his way to a stool. He places his hand on the counter.
Another hand, a young woman's, rests itself on his. She guides his fingers to a laminated menu. Conway closes his eyes, opens them, maybe closes them again. Impossible to differentiate.
scene.option: Ask her about the basketball game.

scene.name: order-coffee
scene.line: A cup of coffee would do it. Black ... oily, even. Hot, familiar diner coffee. Conway runs his hand down the menu. The surface is uniformly flat, and slick with condensation.

scene.name: order-waffles
scene.line: Waffles are a safe bet even at some darkened hole-in-the-wall. Conway squints hopelessly at the menu, searching in the dark for some legible text.

scene.name: basketball-game
scene.line: The Wildcats are struggling, but today's was an important game. They could have rallied. Perhaps the waitress heard the game from the kitchen; or maybe she's a fan herself. Conway clears his throat.

scene.name: waitress
scene.line: He feels a warm hand against his cheek, and freezes. Her fingers run across the stubble of his chin. He feels like apologizing. She leans forward, and so does he â€”
